job_description: The Sophos Anti-Virus for Mac team is searching for an energetic and enthusiastic co-op student with an interest in software engineering for the Mac platform.As a member of the team you’ll be involved in many aspects of our agile development process in an open, collaborative environment. This role provides a great opportunity to work in a development team that delivers a premier security product used by more than a million users every day. We are passionate about making very secure, high quality software for the latest Mac platforms, and looking for people with a similar point of view.This position is based at our Canadian office in Vancouver, British Columbia.Try the free Home Edition of our product yourself:http://www.sophos.com/en-us/products/free-tools/sophos-antivirus-for-mac-home-edition.aspxLearn more about Sophos (including some great comedy) from our video library:http://www.sophos.com/en-us/products/videos.aspxMain DutiesYou will be working closely with developers, QA engineers, and the Development Manager to build internal test tools and participate in feature development. You will be involved in the testing of your work to ensure the product is of high quality before being delivered to customers.Specifically this includes:Write code as directed by Development Manager to deliver against specified project timescales quality and functionality requirementsTest product quality through test driven development (tdd) and usingSophos best practices to ensure high product standards are maintainedPair with other engineers to develop production code, facilitate training, transfer knowledge, and assist in the debugging processProvide clear updates on progress against assigned tasksBuild and maintain an effective relationship with team membersEstimate time and resource allocation for product requirements as related to individual projects.Depending on experience, skill and desire, you may be involved in advanced development tasks.You will be working as part of a team of experienced software development professionals, using the latest tools, technologies, and industry best practices. The team has a healthy ‘continuous improvement’ mindset, and you are expected to be part of that culture.This is for 4 months and extendable for another 4 months.  This is an onsite role.  Salary is negotiable at this point of time.
job_requirements: Essential Experience and SkillsExperience writing software using C or similarAbility to write code in line with defined requirementsAbility to learn and understand complex systems and technical issuesAbility to collaborate with senior developers and QA engineersAbility to organize own time to deliver against tasks set by othersAbility to build stable and useful working relationships within a small project team and immediate development teamDesirable Experience and SkillsExperience with quality assurance for Mac softwareExperience working in an agile environmentExperience using Perl, Python or Ruby (we build lots of tools with these)Experience working with web or virus protection software Open To All Majors:No
